item.title: Hegseth tries to distance himself from boat strike fallout as White House emphasizes admiral’s role
item.description: The Washington Post reported exclusively Friday that Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth gave a spoken order to kill the entire crew of a vessel thought to be ferrying narcotics in the Caribbean Sea. When two survivors were detected, the military commander overseeing the operation, Adm. Frank M. Bradley, directed another strike to comply with Hegseth’s order that no one be left alive, people with direct knowledge of the matter told The Post.

item.title: The White House revealed its pared-back Christmas display — with a Trump LEGO portrait and ‘Be Best’ baubles
item.description: In her first holiday back in charge of White House decor, first lady Melania Trump presented a straightforward, even understated — at least by White House standards — look. The tour route differs from years past because the traditional entrance has been leveled to build President Donald Trump’s 90,000-square-foot ballroom.

item.title: The alleged National Guard shooter once served in an elite CIA-backed unit. But his life unraveled as a refugee in the U.S.
item.description: The course of Rahmanullah Lakanwal’s journey from a trusted U.S. battlefield ally to the suspected shooter of two National Guard members on the streets of downtown D.C. remains unclear, in part. But like many Afghans who had worked for the United States and came to this country after the chaotic August 2021 U.S. withdrawal from Afghanistan, he appeared to struggle to adapt to his new circumstances.

item.title: D.C. police to begin patrolling with National Guard after fatal attack

item.title: D.C. Mayor Muriel E. Bowser (D) will not run for fourth term, a decision bound to usher in a competitive mayoral race
